content: @bjorn3 why did you exclude rustc_codegen_cranelift from the workspace in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/cf798c1ec65a5ec3491846777f9003fabb881b4a ? It means that things like x doc rustc_codegen_cranelift don't work because they find the crate path from cargo metadata.

At the time the Cargo.lock of cg_clif was the only thing ensuring that the right cranelift git commit was used. I have since switched over to using cranelift from crates.io. In addition the Cargo.toml contains several [profile] sections. Cargo has a warning when doing this outside of the workspace root.
Got it. This is relevant for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/95504, will post a comment in a sec

And finally cg_clif still has one git dep left (rust-ar) and vendoring isn't correctly wired up for cg_clif git deps so adding it to the root workspace would break offline builds. I am planning on replacing it with a crate that will be published on crates.io both for this reason and to fix a bug in it on macOS.

On line 627 you could filter rustc_codegen_cranelift as workaround I think: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/95504/files#diff-2c535309cd3faad3c4389a255384eaf9787774f06e52e6cdcbf60fcb7a247e73R627
I suppose so, but silently ignoring crate paths doesn't seem great either :/
Yeah. I hope to work a bit more on it soon, but your PR will probably land before that.
(fyi it's not clear to me whether it's going to land at all yet)
anyway, none of this is urgent - no one is going to remove x doc compiler without finding a replacement
